\parindent=0pt
\hoffset=2em
\def\manheader#1\par{}
\def\mansection#1\par{\par\vskip 1em \moveleft2em\vtop{#1}\par}
\def\manboldline#1\par{{\bf #1}\par}
\def\manoption #1\par #2\par{#1\par \hskip 2em #2\par}
\def\emph#1{{\it #1\/}}
\def\textbf#1{{\bf #1}}

% DO NOT MODIFY THIS FILE!  It was generated by help2man 1.43.3
\manheader WC "1" "March 2015" "GNU coreutils 8.23" "User Commands"

\mansection NAME

wc {-} print newline, word, and byte counts for each file

\mansection SYNOPSIS

\manboldline wc
[{\it OPTION\/}]... [{\it FILE\/}]...
\par

\manboldline wc
[{\it OPTION\/}]... {\it --files0-from=F\/}

\mansection DESCRIPTION

% Add any additional description here
Print newline, word, and byte counts for each FILE, and a total line if
more than one FILE is specified.  With no FILE, or when FILE is {-},
read standard input.  A word is a non{-}zero{-}length sequence of characters
delimited by white space.
The options below may be used to select which counts are printed, always in
the following order: newline, word, character, byte, maximum line length.

\manoption
{\bf {-}c}, {\bf {-}{-}bytes}

print the byte counts

\manoption
{\bf {-}m}, {\bf {-}{-}chars}

print the character counts

\manoption
{\bf {-}l}, {\bf {-}{-}lines}

print the newline counts

\manoption
{\bf {-}{-}files0{-}from}={\it F\/}

read input from the files specified by
NUL{-}terminated names in file F;
If F is {-} then read names from standard input

\manoption
{\bf {-}L}, {\bf {-}{-}max{-}line{-}length}

print the length of the longest line

\manoption
{\bf {-}w}, {\bf {-}{-}words}

print the word counts

\manoption
{\bf {-}{-}help}

display this help and exit

\manoption
{\bf {-}{-}version}

output version information and exit

\mansection AUTHOR

Written by Paul Rubin and David MacKenzie.

\mansection REPORTING BUGS

Report wc translation bugs to http://translationproject.org/team/
